posts.html:
@bijart_dauth
The Urzatron are not eclipsed by cloudpost. Cloudpost is only a single card and thus you can have only 1 playset in the deck. Furthermore, coming into play tapped is a huge disadvantage.
These can be played in any artifact deck as though they were basic lands.

Posted By: aba1 (4/21/2010 10:39:16 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@kiseki:  
  
+[Glimmerpost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glimmerpost)  
+[Vesuva](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vesuva)  
  
With the full 12 of them out, you can have 100 mana every turn. This is known as 12-post. Even if you add [Vesuva](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vesuva) to Urzatron, you can still only have a maximum of 30 mana, and from a total of 4 extra lands too. So, sorry, but Urzatron is obscured by 12-post. Still, if you're running an all-colorless deck, there's really no reason not to run both.
posts.html:
@kiseki:

+Glimmerpost
+Vesuva

With the full 12 of them out, you can have 100 mana every turn. This is known as 12-post. Even if you add Vesuva to Urzatron, you can still only have a maximum of 30 mana, and from a total of 4 extra lands too. So, sorry, but Urzatron is obscured by 12-post. Still, if you're running an all-colorless deck, there's really no reason not to run both.
